text: Malla Jawira (Aymara malla lead, jawira river, (see: Plomo) "lead river", Hispanicized spelling Malla Jahuira) is a river in the La Paz Department in Bolivia. It is a right tributary of the Luribay River whose waters flow to the La Paz River.Bolivian IGM map 1:50,000 Araca 6043-I Malla Jawira originates near the mountain León Jiwata of the Kimsa Cruz mountain range in the Loayza Province, Malla Municipality. At first it flows to the southwest along the mountains named P'iq'iñ Q'ara and Malla Qullu, the little town of Malla and Qillqata where it turns to the northwest. Some of its affluents from the right are Wila Jawira and Jach'a K'uchu Jawira. The confluence with the Luribay River is within the Luribay Municipality near Wila Qura (Vilacora), north of Luribay.Bolivian IGM map 1:50,000 Yaco 6142-IV ==References== Category:Rivers of La Paz Department (Bolivia)
title: Malla Jawira
